clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Sensimed Triggerfish With Goldmann Applanation Tonometry and Perkins Tonometry
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Sensimed Triggerfish (TF) 24 Hour IOP Monitoring With Goldmann Applanation Tonometry (GAT) and Perkins Tonometry in Glaucoma Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective, crossover study is designed to correlate SENSIMED Triggerfish® (TF) continuous IOP monitoring with conventional 24 h intraocular pressure profiles in glaucoma patients. There are two control measurements: The GAT/Perkins profile in the same eye in the second night and the GAT/Perkins profile in the same night in the fellow eye. Therefore, each eye serves as test eye and also as control for the second test eye.

primary_outcome.measure: Relation of GAT/Perkins with TF in a cross-over regression analysis.
primary_outcome.description: Correlation of GAT/Perkins values with TF data (mean, min, max, fluctuation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of IOP in the test eye (TF) compared to a conventional 24h IOP profile (GAT) the reference eye (same night)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of GAT/Perkins values with TF data (mean, min, max, fluctuation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of IOP profile (GAT) right versus left eye
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of GAT/Perkins values in the right and left eye (mean, min, max, fluctuation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of IOP profile (TF) right versus left eye
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of TF data right and left eye (mean, min, max, fluctuation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of IOP with blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of GAT/Perkins values and TF data with systolic and diastolic blood pressure(mean, min, max, fluctuation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of IOP with heart rate
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of GAT/Perkins values and TF data with pulse rate(mean, min, max, fluctuation)

intervention.description: IOP will be monitored for 24 hours
IOP will be measured every two hours within 24 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is able to comply with the study procedure
- Patient must be ≥ 18 years old
- Diagnosis of primary open angle glaucoma (EGS criteria)
- Similar behaviour of IOP in both eyes in former IOP profiles
- Patient has consented to be in the trial and signed informed consent is available before any study related procedures are carried out
- Visual Acuity of 20/200 or better in both eyes
- Ability of subject to understand the character and individual consequences of the study
- For women with childbearing potential, adequate contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
